author: chfast
content: Should we add any new test cases?

author: ben_a_adams
content:
Was reverting state changes on deploy fail; was our error (I think).

Does make me wonder what happens (and what should happen) if you send value to the expected contract address and the deploy fails due to invalid code; should you get the value back or is it potentially lost? ðŸ¤”

author: ben_a_adams
content: Oh, perhaps you can't send as no To address

author: jochembrouwer
content: The tx call frame itself will end once you deploy the code. So if that fails, there is no "call frame" available to perform any other operations (such as interacting with the contract / sending value) ðŸ™‚

author: gurukamath
content: Have all of the `evmone` tests mentioned in the implementation matrix been ported over to EEST?

author: chfast
content: <@425343240212971521> is still working on porting them. But they are still available in the evmone's releases.

author: _shemnon
content: The value in a contract creation account is the "stipend" and is set as the account's initial balance.  But if the EOF is invalid then the account is not generated, and hence no value is transferred in.

author: ben_a_adams
content: Might need a test for this then if isn't one? ðŸ¤”
